messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
There is a strange man outside our home, and he's hollering and crying out. I don't know what's going on with him.
Can you see anything about him? What he looks like?
No, it's dark and raining.
Did he have a vehicle, or is he on foot?
He's on foot.
Has he come to your door or windows?
He's at our door.
He's at your front door?
He's at our back deck.
Okay, hold on one second for me, okay?
I'm going to give you to my wife. I'm going to go get my gun.
Hello.
Ma'am, hold on one second for me, okay?
Okay.
Oh my God. Hey, get out of there!
Ma'am, what's wrong?
He's trying to break down the door.
Okay, ma'am, we've got deputies headed that way, okay?
All right, thank you.
Don't hang up with me, okay?
Okay.
No matter what happens, just don't hang up the phone. You can set it down if you have to.
I think he's got a gun.
Get out of the way, get out of the way.
He has a gun. I don't know if that's what he's got.
Ma'am, can you see the gun?
No, I don't know if that's what it is. He's trying to break down the door. I can't tell.
We have louvers on the door and the door is shut. It's a sliding glass door.
Is he able to get in the door?
Not right now. He's trying.
What's he doing now, ma'am?
He's asking what date it is. He's talking about Vietnam in 1969.
Is he talking to your husband rationally?
No, he is not.
Does your husband know him?
No, we can't even see who it is.
Did you hear a vehicle or anything like that pull up, or did he just walk?
I didn't know he was there until he was at the back door. I can't tell. It's dark.
Can you ask your husband to look to see if it looks like he has a weapon?
I do not want to look because he's beating on the door and I'm afraid if I open the screen, he's going to come through.
Okay, what's he doing now?
I don't hear anything now.
Is your husband still at the back door?
We're standing here in the kitchen, and he's trying to get into the sliding glass door.
What side of the house is the sliding glass door on?
It's in the back of the house.
Okay, tell your husband to keep talking to him if he can.
He's talking about busting the door down and something about a watch. He's given us a few minutes; he's counting down.
The guy outside the house is counting down, saying he's going to bust the door down?
Yes, I don't want to hurt you, okay?
He's talking about Vietnam.
Is he talking to your husband?
No, he is not.
Okay. Does your husband know him?
No, we don't know who he is. We can't see him.
Okay, we don't want to hang up.
They're on the way. We've got several officers on the way.
Tell your husband to look to see if that man has a weapon.
I do not want to look because he's beating on the door.
Okay, where's your husband right now?
We're standing here in the kitchen, and he's trying to get into the sliding glass door.
What's he doing now, ma'am?
I don't hear anything now.
Is he still at the back deck?
He's at the back deck.
Okay, I've got officers on the way, so please stay on the phone.
He's saying he doesn't care who my husband is.
Is he talking about Vietnam?
Yes, and he's beating on the door.
Okay, ma'am. There should be a deputy close.
I hear him walking around outside on the deck. He's trying to get through the door. You have got to get somebody here.
They're on the way, ma'am. I promise, okay? They're coming as fast as they can.
What door is he beating on? The sliding glass door at the back?
Yes, the sliding glass door at the back.
Do you have any neighbors or anything like that, that could be of help?
No.
Is he talking to your husband?
He's beating on the door. I can see the glass is going to break.
I can hear it, okay? I have officers on the way. Just stay on the phone with me. Everything's going to be alright.
He's saying he doesn't care who my husband is. Are you a soldier?
Okay.
He's beating the door, and it's glass.
I can hear him saying he doesn't care who you are.
The back sliding glass door.
Okay, ma'am. There should be a deputy close, okay?
Okay, he's at the back deck.
Oh my God, he's getting ready to come in.
Oh my God! Oh my Lord!
Ma'am? Ma'am?
He just came through and my husband shot him, but he's still moving.
The husband shot him. Where did he shoot him?
I don't know.
Where is your husband?
He's standing here in the kitchen to make sure he doesn't come in.
I want you to tell your husband to put the gun down.
What if he comes in to try to attack him?
Ma'am, if he shot him, he's not going to get up. Tell your husband to put the gun down, please.
She says to put the gun down.
Is he laying on the ground? Is he breathing?
We cannot tell.
Is it still dark? Is he on the back deck?
Yes, he's laying on the back deck.
Okay, ma'am. It's going to be okay.
They just turned on the light.
Ma'am, there's a deputy there, okay?
Yes.
Where is the man that your husband shot?
I guess he's still out on the back deck.
I need to talk to your husband. Where is your husband?
He's right here.
I need to talk to him.
Here, talk to him.
Hello.
Yes, sir. Have you put the weapon down?
I have put the weapon down.
Okay, now what happened?
He busted through my back patio door and was coming into the house. I shot two shots at him in the chest.
Is he laying on the back deck?
I'm pretty sure; it's dark. I hear him moaning.
